titleStmt.title: John H. Hamilton et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4974

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We the undersigned Citizens of Brownsville and Edmonson County Join in the prayer of the petitioner knowing the circumstances by which he was surrounded and his condition at the time he is charged to have suffered gaming in his Store house; We feel that his is a case that Justly deserves Executive clemency

Aron Lawson C. E. C. C
J. E. Bacon P. J. E. C.
William Hazlip Depty Provonce marshal
P. F. Edwards } F. E. C
T. J. Sweeney Asst. U. S. Assessor
Jacob Sauders
J F Alford
J J Raymer
Burel Massey
Simeon Brooks
James Sock P. B. C.
E. P. Sanders County Assessor
John H. Williams
A. Lancaster
John H Hamilton Juror
Edwin Hamilton Juror
Wiley Jones Jueran
D.. J.. W.. Jones - Juror
L J Procter
Asel Hanchin Juror
James Walker
J. H. Crump
J P Jackson
M. M. Palmer
J. J. Honaker

Edmonson Circt Court
Jno. W. Baily
